recipe: Grilled ham, egg & spiced oven chips
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 large baking potatoes"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp paprika"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp cayenne pepper"},{"ingredients":"2 thick slices ham"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"tomato ketchup , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Cut the potatoes into chunky chips, place in a pan of salted water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 5 mins until softened slightly, then drain and leave to steam-dry for a few mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour 3 tbsp of the oil into a shallow baking tray and place in the oven to heat for 5 mins. Meanwhile, toss the chips with the paprika, cayenne pepper and some salt. Carefully tip the chips into the hot oil and return the tray to the oven to cook for 40 mins, tossing them halfway through cooking."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Ten mins before the chips are ready, heat a large griddle pan. Cook the ham slices for 3 mins each side until they are hot and have griddle lines on both sides. Transfer to a plate to keep warm. In a small frying pan, heat the remaining oil and fry the eggs to your liking. Top each slice of ham with an egg and serve with the oven chips, and ketchup if you like."}]

recipe: Cherry tomato & ham bread & butter bake
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"25g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"4 thick slices stale white bread"},{"ingredients":"12 cherry tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"50g ham , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"500ml milk"},{"ingredients":"3 eggs"},{"ingredients":"50g cheddar , grated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Mix the butter and garlic together, then use a little to grease a shallow baking dish or tin. Use the rest to butter the bread slices, then cut them in half diagonally."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Arrange the bread slices, overlapping, in the baking dish. Tuck the cherry tomatoes and ham in and around them."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Whisk the milk and eggs together, and season with salt and pepper. Pour over the bread and gently push the slices down in the liquid. Leave to stand for 5 mins. Scatter the cheese over the top, then bake for 35-40 mins until golden and just set. Serve with a crisp green salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g chopped  vegetables such as onions, celery and carrots"},{"ingredients":"300g potatoes,  cubed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp oil"},{"ingredients":"700ml stock"},{"ingredients":"crème fraîche and fresh herbs, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the vegetables and potatoes in a pan with the oil for a few minutes until beginning to soften."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cover with the stock and simmer for 10-15 mins until the veg is tender. Blend until smooth, then season. Serve with a dollop of crème fraîche and some fresh herbs. Will freeze for up to one month."}]

recipe: Brie bruschetta with tomato, herbs & Serrano ham
name: Brie bruschetta with tomato, herbs & Serrano ham

recipe: Chicken, ham, leek & roast potato pie
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"400g chicken breast , cut into small chunks"},{"ingredients":"140g thick-sliced ham , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"roughly leftover roast potato , large ones halved"},{"ingredients":"2 leeks , trimmed and sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 heaped tbsp plain flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"200ml white wine"},{"ingredients":"400ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"3 heaped tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"375g shortcrust pastry sheet (use fresh if you're freezing the pie)"},{"ingredients":"beaten egg , to glaze"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat half the oil in a large frying pan and brown the chicken for about 5 mins. Tip into a 22 x 28cm ovenproof pie dish, then evenly scatter over the ham and roast potatoes. Heat the remaining oil and soften the leeks for about 5 mins, then stir in the flour for 1 min."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the wine and stock. Bring to the boil and, stirring continuously, boil rapidly to reduce to a thick sauce. Take off the heat, then stir in the crème fraîche and seasoning. Pour over the pie filling and leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Unroll the pastry and cut off a small strip to make decorations (if you like). Roll the remainder to fit the dish and place on top of the pie. Use a fork to crimp the edges and press the pastry to the edge of the dish. Make a small hole in the centre, then cover well with cling film. Freeze for up to 3 months. For best results, defrost at room temperature for 8 hrs."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Brush pie with egg to glaze (making sure the steam hole hasn’t sealed up). Cook for 30-40 mins, until golden and hot through."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp soft butter"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs , beaten"},{"ingredients":"100ml milk"},{"ingredients":"4 hot cross buns , split in half"},{"ingredients":"vanilla ice cream and maple syrup, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix 3 tbsp of the butter with half the cinnamon and mash together. Beat together the egg, milk and remaining cinnamon. Sandwich 2 slices of hot cross bun together with half the cinnamon butter and repeat with the remaining two slices."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Dip in the egg mix and leave to soak for a few secs. Heat the butter in a frying pan until foaming. Cook the hot cross buns for 1-2 mins each side until light golden (you may need to do this in two batches). Press down on them as you cook. Serve each portion topped with a scoop of ice cream and a drizzle of maple syrup, if you like."}]

recipe: Salmon & Puy lentil salad with olive dressing
name: Salmon & Puy lentil salad with olive dressing

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g cod loin, skinless and boneless"},{"ingredients":"175g cooked king prawns , chopped"},{"ingredients":"175g mashed potato"},{"ingredients":"small bunch chives , snipped"},{"ingredients":"zest 1 lemon , plus 1 lemon cut into wedges, to serve"},{"ingredients":"5 eggs , 1 beaten"},{"ingredients":"50g breadcrumbs"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"200g green beans"},{"ingredients":"100g cherry tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp white wine vinegar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. In a small saucepan cover the cod with cold water and gently poach for 3-4 mins until just cooked through. Remove with a slotted spoon and pat dry. Flake into a medium bowl with the prawns, potato and most of the chives, lemon zest and some seasoning. Shape into 4 even-size cakes and chill for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Dip each cake in the beaten egg, then coat in the breadcrumbs, repeat with the remaining fish cakes. Brush each cake with 1 tsp of the olive oil, place on a roasting tray and cook for 25 mins, turning halfway through. Cook beans in salted boiling water for 3-4 mins, until tender, adding the tomatoes for the final min. Drain and toss through the remaining oil, vinegar and reserved chives, mashing the tomatoes lightly with a fork, season with some black pepper and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"For the poached eggs bring a shallow pan of water to just boiling, stir the water once or twice and crack in the eggs. Poach for 3-4 mins, then remove with a slotted spoon. Serve the fishcakes topped with a poached egg and garnished with the beans and a few wedges of lemon for squeezing over."}]

recipe: Salmon & Puy lentil salad with olive dressing
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"85g Kalamata olive , stoned"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 small garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chopped basil (or a dash of pesto)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp small capers"},{"ingredients":"200g pack fine green bean , halved"},{"ingredients":"3-4 eggs (depending on how much salmon you have)"},{"ingredients":"2 x 250g pouches cooked Puy lentils (we used Merchant Gourmet)"},{"ingredients":"4 large tomatoes , deseeded and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"175g-200g cooked leftover salmon , flaked into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"good handful rocket leaves"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Chop half the olives (set the rest aside), then mix with the remaining dressing ingredients in a bowl."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Boil the green beans for 5 mins, then refresh under cold water. Put the eggs in cold water, bring to the boil, then cook for 5 mins. Cool, shell and halve or quarter."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the lentils in the microwave for 2 mins per pack. Tip into a bowl and toss with the tomatoes, most of the dressing, the whole olives and green beans. Arrange eggs and salmon on top, scatter with the rocket and finish with remaining dressing. Serve with crusty bread."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g farfalle or other pasta shape"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp reduced-fat mayonnaise (use full-fat if you prefer)"},{"ingredients":"1 heaped tsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"300g cooked chicken , torn into rough pieces"},{"ingredients":"4 spring onions , thinly sliced (or use ½ red onion, thinly sliced)"},{"ingredients":"small bunch basil , leaves roughly torn"},{"ingredients":"4 tomatoes , quartered, then each chunk halved"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil the pasta, then cool under running water. Mix the mayo, mustard and honey in a large bowl and loosen with a little water to make a dressing the consistency of double cream. Add the pasta, chicken, onions, basil and tomatoes, season to taste, then gently mix together."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g quick-cook spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp butter"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"150ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs , beaten"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp freshly grated parmesan"},{"ingredients":"120g pack smoked salmon trimmings"},{"ingredients":"½ small bunch chives , snipped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the spaghetti. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small pan, add the garlic and gently sizzle for 1 min. Remove from the heat."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Lightly beat the cream, eggs, softened garlic and half the Parmesan in a bowl. Stir in the smoked salmon trimmings."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Drain the pasta well and return to the pan. Add the salmon mixture and the chives, then toss well so the heat from the pasta lightly thickens the sauce. Serve scattered with the remaining Parmesan and plenty of black pepper."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 medium  carrots, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp  thyme leaves, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1.4l chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"300g leftover roast chicken, shredded and skin removed"},{"ingredients":"200g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"1  garlic clove, crushed"},{"ingredients":"squeeze of lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"cheese scone, to serve (see tips below)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the olive oil in a large heavy-based pan. Add the onions, carrots and thyme leaves, then gently fry for 15 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in 1.4l chicken stock, bring to a boil, cover, then simmer for 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the leftover roast chicken, remove half the mixture, then purée with a stick blender. Tip back into the pan with the rest of the soup, the peas and seasoning, then simmer for 5 mins until hot through."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Mix the Greek yogurt, garlic and lemon juice together. Ladle the soup into bowls, swirl in the garlic yogurt, then serve."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"If you want to use a slow cooker, gently fry the onions, carrots and thyme leaves for 15 mins, then tip them into the slow cooker with 1 litre stock. If you're using a chicken carcass, add it now. Cover and cook for 2-3 hours on High until the veg is tender. If you used a carcass, remove it now, shredding any remaining chicken from the bones. Stir back into the soup, or add the leftover roast chicken and frozen peas. Cook for 30 mins more. Remove half the mixture and purée with a stick blender, then serve as above."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp butter"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 leeks, finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 large potatoes, cut into small cubes"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp plain flour, plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"300ml chicken or ham stock"},{"ingredients":"100ml pot crème fraîche (or use leftover double cream)"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"200g cooked ham, shredded"},{"ingredients":"4 bay leaves, optional"},{"ingredients":"375g pack puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"1 egg, beaten, to glaze (or use milk)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a large frying pan, melt the butter, then add the onion and leeks. Cover, then very gently cook for 15 mins until soft. Add the potatoes after 5 mins cooking."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir in the flour, turn up the heat, then add the stock, stirring until the mix thickens a little. Take off the heat, then stir in the crème fraîche, mustard and ham. Season to taste, then cool, if you have time. Spoon the mix into a large pie dish, adding a couple of bay leaves. Heat oven to 220C/fan 200C/gas 7."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Roll out the pastry on a floured surface to the thickness of a £1 coin. Cut a pastry strip the same width as the lip of the dish, wet the edge of the dish with egg, then fix the strip around it. Brush the top with egg, then lay over the remaining pastry."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Trim pastry to the edge of the dish, then ruffle the cut edges with the knife blade to help the layers rise. Cut a few slits to let the steam escape, decorate with bay leaves, if you like, then brush all over the top with egg. Can be done up to a day ahead, keep chilled. Bake for 30 mins until risen."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"leftover  lamb , about 200g-300g/7oz-11oz"},{"ingredients":"100g leftover gravy , if you have any, or a splash of lamb stock"},{"ingredients":"leftover potatoes , about 250g/9oz"},{"ingredients":"50g cheese , grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp breadcrumb , with mixed herbs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Carve all leftover lamb off the bone, roughly chop and place in an ovenproof dish, or 2 individual pie dishes. Pour over some gravy, or if there’s none left, just a bit of stock to moisten. Crumble the leftover potatoes over, then scatter with cheese and any leftover herb crumbs. Bake in the oven for 30 mins until golden on top and bubbling around the edge. If you’ve got any greens leftover, then quickly stir-fry to reheat and serve alongside."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp  vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten with about 2 tbsp water"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 heaped tbsp curry powder"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp  tomato ketchup"},{"ingredients":"a large handful of frozen  peas   (about 85g/3oz)"},{"ingredients":"250g leftover cold cooked  rice  (any type) or a 250g pouch of ready cooked rice"},{"ingredients":"175g cooked chicken or  pork , shredded into strips"},{"ingredients":"a good splash of  soy sauce"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat half the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over a highish heat. Pour in the beaten egg, swoosh it around the pan and leave it to set for a minute. Flip it over like a pancake and let it cook for a minute more on the otherside, then tip it out flat on to a plate."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in the same pan. Tip in the onion and sizzle for 3-4 minutes until it’s starting to brown, then stir in the garlic, curry powder and ketchup. Add the peas and cook for a minute or two until they start to defrost. Tip in the rice, cooked meat and a glass of water (100ml/31⁄2fl oz) and cook over a medium heat for 5-6 minutes, stirring as you go, until everything’s piping hot and the rice has taken on the colour of the curry powder."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"While your rice is frying, shred the omelette into long strips. Toss the omelette and soy sauce through the rice and cook for a moment more. Scoop the rice on to plates straight from the pan and serve with extra soy sauce for sprinkling over."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp butter , plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp chopped  sage"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground mace"},{"ingredients":"300g boneless, skinless  chicken thigh (about 3)"},{"ingredients":"1kg cooked  ham , trimmed of fat and thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"50g shelled pistachio"},{"ingredients":"50g cranberry (fresh or frozen)"},{"ingredients":"50g dried apricot , diced"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp chopped parsley"},{"ingredients":"good grating  nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"700g skinless  chicken breast , halved to thin"},{"ingredients":"chutney and  salad to serve, (optional)"},{"ingredients":"375g plain white flour"},{"ingredients":"375g strong  white flour"},{"ingredients":"140g butter"},{"ingredients":"175g lard"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"3 gelatine leaves"},{"ingredients":"500ml strong chicken stock , heated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Soften the onion in the butter with the sage and mace. Cool for a few mins while you whizz the chicken thighs and 300g of the ham in a food processor until minced. Scrape into a large bowl and stir in the softened onion, pistachios, cranberries, apricots and parsley. Season with nutmeg, lots of black pepper and some salt."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Grease a deep, 20cm round springform or loose-bottomed tin, then line with baking parchment. To make the pastry, mix together the flours and 2 tsp salt in a large bowl, then make a well in the centre. Put the butter and lard into a small pan with 200ml water and very gently melt. Once melted, turn up the heat and when just bubbling, pour into the well and stir with a wooden spoon to a dough – don’t worry if some powdery bits remain."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Once cool enough to handle, knead in the bowl until the dough comes together, then tip onto your work surface. Set aside a third, wrapped in a clean tea towel to keep it as warm and pliable as possible, while you quickly roll the remaining dough into a large circle – big enough to line the tin with a little overhanging."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Ease the circle into the tin, pressing evenly into the corners and side – you can be rough with it. Evenly cover the base with half the remaining sliced ham, followed by half the chicken breasts and half the mince mixture, pressing firmly to pack. Repeat with the remaining ham and chicken, then a rounded dome of mince. Put a pie funnel, if you have one, on the top."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Roll the reserved dough to a circle large enough to easily cover the pie, cutting out a hole (if using a pie funnel). Brush the edge of the pie with some beaten egg and top with the pastry lid. Press to seal the edges before trimming the excess. Crimp the edges between your thumb and forefinger to seal thoroughly, then make a small hole in the middle to let steam escape (if not using a pie funnel). Brush the top of the pie with more beaten egg."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180 fan/gas 6. Bake the pie for 1 hr. Very, very carefully remove the pie from its tin, brush the top and side with more egg and bake for another 30 mins until browned and crisp. Leave to cool completely before chilling."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"To make the jelly, soak the gelatine in cold water for 5-10 mins until soft. Squeeze out any excess water from the gelatine, then dissolve in the hot stock. Once cooled, carefully pour into your chilled pie through the small hole, using a funnel, until full – you may not need all the stock. Chill the pie for a few hrs. Serve with chutney and salad, if you like."}]

recipe: Cherry tomato & ham bread & butter bake
name: Cherry tomato & ham bread & butter bake

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g leftover cooked  potato  (roasted or boiled – see step 1)"},{"ingredients":"1 leek , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2heaped tbsp horseradish  sauce"},{"ingredients":"5heaped tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"100g cooked  ham , chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"pinch of dried  thyme"},{"ingredients":"375g packet ready-rolled  puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp milk"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the filling, preheat the oven to 220C/gas 7/fan 200C. Slice your potato leftovers as best you can, then blanch the leek in boiling water for 3 minutes and drain. If you don’t have any leftovers, peel, halve and thickly slice a baking potato, then boil for 8 minutes, adding the sliced leek for the last 3 minutes. Drain. In a large bowl, mix the potato, leek, horseradish sauce, crème fraîche, ham and thyme, mushing up the potato slightly, then season well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To make the pie, unroll the pastry rectangle onto a baking sheet. Pile the filling along the length of one half of the pastry, leaving a small gap on the outside edge. Brush milk round the edges of the pastry. Fold the uncovered side over the filling, then press the pastry edges together well, using the prongs of a fork, to seal. Make a few 6cm diagonal slashes in the top. (The pie can now be frozen for up to a month.)"},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To bake the pie, brush the pie with the remaining milk and bake for 30 minutes until golden brown. Leave to relax for a couple of minutes then cut into slices and serve with a green salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp oil"},{"ingredients":"1  egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"2 rashers  bacon , chopped"},{"ingredients":"175g mushrooms , sliced"},{"ingredients":"200g  frozen  peas"},{"ingredients":"1  garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"small knob of  ginger , grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp  dark  soy sauce , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"250g  cooked  basmati rice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a frying pan, then tip in the egg. Leave to set for 30 secs-1 min, swirling every now and again, then tip it out and finely slice. Add the bacon and mushrooms to pan, then fry until golden, about 3 mins. Add the peas, garlic and ginger, then cook for 1 min."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the soy sauce and sugar together. Turn up the heat, add the cooked rice to the pan, heat through, then splash in the sweet soy sauce. Stir through the egg and serve straight away, with more soy sauce if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1kg plums (or apples), stoned and quartered"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"200g madeira cake , diced into cubes"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp double cream or custard"},{"ingredients":"handful  flaked almond or chopped pistachios"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar , for dusting"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Simmer the plums, covered, with 200ml water and sugar until softened. Tip into a baking dish and scatter over the madeira cake."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Drizzle with double cream, scatter with the nuts and dust with icing sugar. Bake at 180C/160C fan/gas 4, just until browning."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g mascarpone"},{"ingredients":"300ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp  caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp cream sherry (we used Harvey's Bristol Cream)"},{"ingredients":"200g thin after-dinner  mints , plus 6 extra to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the mascarpone, double cream, caster sugar and sherry in a bowl and whisk until thick enough to hold its shape. Break 200g of the after-dinner mints into small pieces, then beat these into the cream mixture. Spoon into tiny glasses or bowls and chill until needed. Add 1 more thin after-dinner mint to each dessert before serving"}]

recipe: Cold roast beef with beetroot salad & horseradish cream
name: Cold roast beef with beetroot salad & horseradish cream

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g butter , melted, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"140g sultana or raisins"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 2 oranges , or 4 clementines"},{"ingredients":"300g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"300g light soft brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp mixed spice"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs , beaten with a fork"},{"ingredients":"300g carrots, parsnips, pumpkin, butternut squash or swede , or a mixture, grated"},{"ingredients":"200g icing sugar or fondant icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"few crushed white sugar cubes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Grease and line a 30 x 20cm baking or roasting tin with baking parchment. Mix the sultanas and zest and juice from 1 orange (or 2 clementines), and microwave on High for 2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the flour, caster sugar, spices, bicarb and pinch of salt into a large bowl. Mix the eggs with the melted butter and sultana mixture, then tip into the dry ingredients and stir in with a wooden spoon. Stir in the grated veg, and scrape into the tin. Bake for 35 - 40 mins, or until a skewer poked in the centre comes out clean. Cool in the tin."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Once cool sift the icing sugar into a bowl and stir in remaining orange zest plus enough juice to make a runny icing. Drizzle all over the cake and scatter with the crushed sugar cubes. Leave to set, then slice into 15 squares to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 roasted  pork shoulder chops (see 'Goes well with...')"},{"ingredients":"winter celeriac slaw (see 'Goes well with...')"},{"ingredients":"a little  wholegrain mustard , for spreading"},{"ingredients":"4 burger buns , halved, and toasted if eating at home"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"If you’re eating lunch at home, gently heat the meat in a microwave for a few mins, or wrap in foil and bake at 200C/180C fan/gas 6 for 8 mins. If you’re assembling packed lunches, there’s no need to heat. Thinly slice the pork."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Spread some mustard over the bun bottoms, then add the pork and a heap of slaw. Top with bun tops, wrap and keep cool until lunchtime or eat straight away."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp duck fat, goose fat or butter"},{"ingredients":"4 rashers of  streaky bacon, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, chopped"},{"ingredients":"15-20 cooked Brussels sprouts, sliced, or leftover boiled cabbage, shredded"},{"ingredients":"400g cold  leftover mashed potato, or cold crushed boiled potatoes"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt 1 tbsp duck fat, goose fat or butter in a non-stick pan, allow it to get nice and hot, then add 4 chopped streaky bacon rashers. As it begins to brown, add 1 finely sliced onion and 1 chopped garlic clove."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Next, add 15-20 sliced cooked Brussels sprouts or shredded boiled cabbage and let it colour slightly. All this will take 5-6 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 400g cold mashed potato. Work everything together in the pan and push it down so that the mixture covers the base of the pan."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Allow the mixture to catch slightly on the base of the pan before turning it over and doing the same again. It’s the bits of potato that catch in the pan that define the term ‘bubble and squeak’, so be brave and let the mixture colour."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Cut into wedges and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 small baguette , cut lengthways"},{"ingredients":"sprinkle olive oil and red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"pinch dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"handful leftover lamb"},{"ingredients":"few slices red pepper and red or white onion"},{"ingredients":"shredded lettuce"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp crumbled feta cheese"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Sprinkle the inside of the baguette with a little olive oil, vinegar, oregano and a little seasoning. Layer the lamb, salad veg and feta, then wrap tightly in cling film."}]

recipe: Cold roast beef with beetroot salad & horseradish cream
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"thin slices  leftover roast beef"},{"ingredients":"3 small cooked beetroot , sliced, then cut into fine matchsticks"},{"ingredients":"1 shallot , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 handfuls of a mix of bitter leaves, such as  frisée , mizuna and watercress"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"selection  of micro-leaves , if you can get them"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp grated horseradish"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"pinch mustard  powder"},{"ingredients":"juice 1⁄2 lemon"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the horseradish cream, whisk all the ingredients together with salt and pepper until spoonable, then set aside. Lay the slices of beef on four serving plates. In a bowl, mix the beetroot, shallot and salad leaves together. Dress with the sherry vinegar and 3 tbsp of the olive oil, then gently toss."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Neatly pile a mound of salad into the centre of each plate and scatter some microleaves around the outside. Top the salad with a neat spoonful of horseradish cream, drizzle with the remaining olive oil and serve."}]

recipe: Warm lentil salad with Serrano, chicken & rocket
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 red onion , halved and very thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"handful flat-leaf parsley , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 ripe tomatoes , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp small capers , drained"},{"ingredients":"250g pouch ready-cooked Puy lentil (I used Merchant Gourmet)"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil , plus extra"},{"ingredients":"8 slices Serrano ham"},{"ingredients":"meat from 2 cooked chicken breasts , torn into pieces"},{"ingredients":"100g bag wild rocket"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the onion in a bowl, drizzle over the vinegar, then season with salt and pepper. Set aside for 10 mins or so until the onion has softened slightly."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, in another large bowl, mix the parsley and tomatoes with the capers. When ready to serve, tip the lentils into a sieve and rinse with boiling water from the kettle. Drain. Toss the onions and their juices into the lentils, then add the 2 tbsp olive oil and carefully mix everything together. Scoop this onto a large serving platter, then top with the ham, chicken and rocket. Drizzle with more olive oil and a little more vinegar, if you like, then serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"6 rashers smoked streaky bacon"},{"ingredients":"2 Little Gem lettuces , chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 celery sticks, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 cooked chicken breast and 1 cooked chicken leg, skinned and shredded"},{"ingredients":"75g blue cheese , crumbled"},{"ingredients":"2 hard-boiled eggs , halved"},{"ingredients":"crusty bread (optional)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"2 spring onions , finely sliced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fry the bacon until crisp and cooked through, then very roughly chop."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To make the dressing, mix the olive oil, vinegar, mustard and honey with 1 tbsp water and some seasoning. Save 2 tbsp in the fridge for another salad (see 'Goes well with'). Stir the spring onions into the rest of the dressing."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Use the chopped lettuce and celery as a base, then arrange the bacon, chicken, blue cheese and hard-boiled eggs on top and drizzle over the dressing. Serve with bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"450g sausagemeat"},{"ingredients":"50g fresh white breadcrumb"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp thyme or rosemary leaves, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"500g carton passata"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sundried tomato paste"},{"ingredients":"300g fusilli or other  pasta shapes"},{"ingredients":"½ small Savoy cabbage , cut into 1cm-wide slices"},{"ingredients":"250g ball mozzarella , cubed"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp freshly grated parmesan"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sausagemeat, breadcrumbs and thyme or rosemary in a bowl and mix to combine. Shape into 20 small balls."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oil in a wide pan and cook the sausageballs for 10 mins until nicely browned. Add passata and tomato paste, cover and simmer gently for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook pasta following pack instructions, adding the cabbage for the final 5 mins of cooking time. Drain cabbage and pasta, toss with the sauce and spoon into a heatproof dish."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/ gas 6. Push mozzarella cubes into the top of the pasta. Sprinkle with Parmesan and bake for 15-20 mins until bubbling and crusty."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"knob of butter , for the dish"},{"ingredients":"4 stale hot cross buns"},{"ingredients":"200g lemon curd"},{"ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"200ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"200ml milk"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"little  lemon zest"},{"ingredients":"cream or vanilla ice cream , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Butter a 1-litre baking dish that will quite snugly fit the buns. Cut each bun into 3 slices, and sandwich back together with a generous spreading of curd. Arrange buns in the dish."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whisk egg, cream, milk and remaining curd, then sieve into a jug with the vanilla and 3 tbsp of the sugar. Pour over the buns and stand at room temperature for 30 mins for the custard to soak in."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/ gas 3. Scatter the remaining sugar and lemon zest over the pudding. Bake for 30-40 mins until the top is golden and the custard gently set. Stand for 5 mins, then serve with cream or vanilla ice cream, if you like."}]

recipe: Warm lentil salad with Serrano, chicken & rocket
name: Warm lentil salad with Serrano, chicken & rocket

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"knob of butter"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 medium potato, peeled and diced"},{"ingredients":"1l ham or pork stock (see 'Try', below)"},{"ingredients":"500g frozen petit pois"},{"ingredients":"300g thickly sliced ham, trimmed of any fat and diced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a knob of butter in a saucepan and when lightly foaming gently cook 1 chopped onion until softened, but not coloured."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip in 1 peeled and diced medium potato and stir to coat in butter, then pour over 1l ham or pork stock. Simmer until softened."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip in 500g frozen petit pois and bring back to the boil. Cook for a couple of mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Remove from the heat and blend until smooth. Stir in 300g diced ham and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 pitta breads"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 diced  aubergine"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp harissa"},{"ingredients":"250g halved cherry tomato"},{"ingredients":"500g shredded leftover turkey breast"},{"ingredients":"100g rocket"},{"ingredients":"seeds 1  pomegranate or 110g tub pomegranate seeds"},{"ingredients":"a few  mint leaves"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tear the pitta into pieces and fry in the olive oil until crisp. Tip into a bowl, then fry the aubergine for 10 mins until soft. Add to the pitta with the harissa, tomatoes, turkey and rocket. Toss well. Scatter over pomegranate seeds and mint leaves."}]

recipe: Grilled ham, egg & spiced oven chips
name: Grilled ham, egg & spiced oven chips

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g butter , plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"25g plain flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"200ml milk"},{"ingredients":"300g leftover hard cheese , cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"100ml double cream or  crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs , separated"},{"ingredients":"grating of  nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"pinch cayenne pepper"},{"ingredients":"110g bag salad leaf"},{"ingredients":"100g leftover blue or  goat's cheese , crumbled"},{"ingredients":"50g leftover shelled nut"},{"ingredients":"1 pear , sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp salad dressing (use your favourite), to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Melt all the butter in a saucepan. Brush a 20cm soufflé dish with a little of it, then dust with flour. In the saucepan, stir the flour into the rest of the melted butter, then sizzle everything for 1 min. Gradually pour in the milk to make a white sauce, then add two-thirds of the cheese and carry on cooking to melt. Leave to cool slightly, then mix in the remaining cheese, the cream or crème fraîche and the egg yolks. Season, then add the nutmeg and cayenne pepper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a clean bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff. Fold into the cheese sauce, then carefully tip into the soufflé dish. Bake the soufflé for 25 mins until puffed up and golden."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"While the soufflé is cooking, toss the salad ingredients together. Once the soufflé is cooked, dress the salad and serve alongside."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1kg potatoes , chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp paprika (use smoked paprika if you have it)"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"300g cooked chicken , shredded"},{"ingredients":"140g roasted pepper from a jar, sliced (we like Karyatis)"},{"ingredients":"handful Kalamata olives , halved"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Boil the potatoes for 15-20 mins until tender. Drain, return to the pan, then mash with some seasoning and 2 tsp of the paprika."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large pan, then fry the onions and garlic for a few mins until softened. Stir in the remaining paprika for 1 min, add the tomatoes , then, bring to a simmer. Tip into a large ovenproof dish, then stir in the chicken, peppers, olives and some seasoning."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon over the mash, then bake for 15 mins until the mash is golden on top and the sauce is bubbling."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2½ tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"450g leek , trimmed and thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"450ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"100g self-raising flour , plus a little extra for rolling the dough"},{"ingredients":"75ml fat-free natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp thyme leaves, plus extra to decorate"},{"ingredients":"140g frozen pea"},{"ingredients":"85g chunk of ham , shredded"},{"ingredients":"1 small apple or ½ large apple, grated"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Heat ½ tbsp oil in a large pan, then fry the leeks, stirring for 5 mins until starting to soften. Add the stock, then simmer for 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, tip the flour into a bowl, make a well in the centre, then add the yogurt, remaining oil, thyme leaves and a little salt. Using a cutlery knife, mix to bring together to a soft dough. Divide into 4 and shape into rounds on a floured surface."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Stir the peas, ham and grated apple into the leeks, then divide between 4 individual pie dishes or one large dish. Top each with a round of dough, scatter with more thyme, then bake for 20 mins until golden."}]

recipe: Brie bruschetta with tomato, herbs & Serrano ham
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 shallots , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"125ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"small bunch chives , snipped"},{"ingredients":"4 thick slices white bloomer-style bread"},{"ingredients":"2 tomatoes , sliced"},{"ingredients":"10-12 slices leftover brie or camembert"},{"ingredients":"4slices Serrano ham or prosciutto"},{"ingredients":"rocket leaves, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 1 tsp olive oil in a saucepan and gently cook the chopped shallots for 2 mins until soft but not coloured. Pour in the cream, bring it to a simmer, then reduce by about half. The cream will look like a thick sauce at this point. Stir in the chives."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat grill to high. Brush the remaining olive oil over the bread and grill on both sides until toasted. Top each slice with some tomato, then cheese, then Serrano ham, and finally spread over about 1 tbsp of the thickened cream to cover the ham. Place back under the hot grill until the cream starts to colour and glaze and the cheese has begun to melt. Serve with rocket leaves scattered over the top."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large potato , diced"},{"ingredients":"1.2l chicken or vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"400g broccoli , chopped into florets"},{"ingredients":"7 slices bread"},{"ingredients":"175g cheese , grated – cheddar, red leicester or any blue cheese"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , chopped"},{"ingredients":"few drops Worcestershire sauce"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the potato and stock in a saucepan and bring to the boil, turn down to simmer for 10 mins until the potato is tender, then add the broccoli and some seasoning and cook for another 4-5 mins. Blend the soup until smooth, then return to the pan and keep warm while you make the toasties."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whizz 1 slice of bread to make crumbs, then stir in the cheese, egg and onions. Spread over 3 slices of bread, add a dash of Worcestershire sauce, and sandwich each one together with the remaining slices. Brush with oil and bake for 10 mins, turning halfway through, until the outside is crisp and golden and middle melted. Cut into triangles and serve with the soup."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 slices day-old crusty white bread , crusts removed"},{"ingredients":"50g very soft butter"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp Seville orange marmalade , plus 4 tsp"},{"ingredients":"300ml full-fat milk"},{"ingredients":"248ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"seeds 1 vanilla pod"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp whisky"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar , for dusting"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Butter each piece of bread on both sides, then spread 4 with the 1 tbsp marmalade each. Pop the remaining bread on top to make 4 marmalade sandwiches. Cut into triangles and nestle in rows in a large baking dish. Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Beat the milk, cream, eggs, vanilla, sugar and whisky together, then pour over the bread. Leave to soak for 30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Dot the remaining marmalade all over the top of the pud and dust with the icing sugar. Bake for 45 mins-1 hr or until puffy and starting to caramelise where the bread breaks out of the custard. Serve hot or warm."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"800g diced  potato"},{"ingredients":"25g butter , plus more for grilling"},{"ingredients":"100g-300g Festive red salad (see 'goes well with')"},{"ingredients":"fried eggs and leftover  ham , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil potatoes until tender. Melt the butter in a shallow pan (ovenproof if you have it), then fry Festive red salad for a few mins to soften. Stir in the well-drained spuds with some seasoning, press down and carry on cooking to crisp the bottom and heat through."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"If you like, dot the top with a bit more butter and grill to crisp it up. Eat with fried eggs and slices of leftover ham, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"butter , for frying"},{"ingredients":"1   leek , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"225g potatoes cooked and cooled (about 1-2 medium size ones)"},{"ingredients":"6 eggs"},{"ingredients":"85g cheddar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sage , finely chopped (or 1 tsp dried sage), optional"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt a knob of butter in a medium, nonstick frying pan, then cook the leek for about 5 mins until softened. Meanwhile, cut the potatoes in half, then into slices about ½cm thick. Beat the eggs, season, then stir in the cheese and sage."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add a little extra butter to the pan if needed, tip in the potatoes, then the egg mixture. Turn the heat to low, then cook for 10 mins until nearly set. Place under a hot grill, then cook for a couple of mins more until the top is set and golden. Slice into wedges and serve with a green salad."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g white or wholemeal bread"},{"ingredients":"500g/1lb 2oz mixed dried fruit"},{"ingredients":"85g mixed peel"},{"ingredients":"1½ tbsp mixed spice"},{"ingredients":"600ml milk"},{"ingredients":"2 large  eggs, beaten"},{"ingredients":"140g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest 1 lemon (optional)"},{"ingredients":"100g butter, melted"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp demerara sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tear 500g white or wholemeal bread into a large mixing bowl and add 500g mixed dried fruit, 85g mixed peel and 1 ½ tbsp mixed spice."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in 600ml milk, then stir or scrunch through your fingers to mix everything well and completely break up the bread."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 2 beaten large eggs, 140g light muscovado sugar and zest of 1 lemon, if using. Stir well, then set aside for 15 mins to soak."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the base of a 20cm non-stick square cake tin (not one with a loose base)."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Stir the melted butter into the pudding mixture, tip into the tin, then scatter with demerara."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Bake for 1½ hrs until firm and golden, covering with foil if it starts to brown too much. Turn out of the tin and strip off the paper. Cut into squares and serve warm."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250ml milk"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp each butter and flour, mixed to a paste, plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"140g button mushroom , cut into quarters"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"140g ham , chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"85g leftover cheese (amount will vary according to type - go with your taste buds), cut into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp chopped herbs - tarragon, parsley and chives all work well"},{"ingredients":"500g block puff pastry"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"The first thing to do is to make a thick white sauce that will be the base of the turnover filling. Bring the milk to a simmer, then add the butter and flour paste. Whisk the paste into the simmering milk and allow it to boil for 3-4 mins, whisking gently all the time to prevent it from catching. You should now have a very thick white sauce. Cool the sauce in a bowl. Fry the mushrooms in the oil for 3-5 mins until golden, then leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place the ham, cheese and mushrooms into a bowl, then gradually add the white sauce until everything is well coated. Finally, add the herbs."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Roll out the pastry on a floured surface to about the thickness of a £1 coin and cut out 4 saucer-size rounds (about 18cm wide), re-rolling the trimmings if you need to. Brush the edges of each round with beaten egg. Spoon the mixture onto 1 side of each round, then fold over and seal the edges well. The turnovers can now be frozen for up to 1 month. Brush the turnover with the remaining egg, then chill for 30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Place the turnovers on a baking sheet and bake for about 35 mins until puffed up and golden. Leave to cool slightly and enjoy warm."}]

recipe: Chicken, ham, leek & roast potato pie
name: Chicken, ham, leek & roast potato pie
